description: Borrowed from Hebrew קַדִּישׁ‎ (kadish, “kaddish”), from Aramaic קַדִּישׁ‎ (qaddīš, “holy; holy person”). Doublet of kiddush.
The plural form kaddishim is borrowed from Hebrew קַדִּישׁים‎ (kadishim).

entries.meaning: (Judaism) A Jewish prayer of praise to God recited during services, and specifically when mourning the death of a close relative.
